page.title: 07THE PARISH COUNCIL
page.content: The Parish Council draws its money from the Rates, via Rother R>D>C> We precept for about a 1p rate, which yields about Â£320, and Rother provides about as much again for special functions, giving us about Â£640 to spend each year. Apart from insur_ ances and a small grant to the clerk, we help support the Church Hall and pay Â£50 towards the wages of a 'Lollipop Lady' who sees our children safely across the rtoad in the afternoon. East Sussex used to pay her to work morning and afternoon, but their spending cuts forced us to provide for her ourselves. Brede School P.T.A. and Brede Parish Council contribute the rest. We also provide and look after four bus shelters. Then, if funds run to it we make a small grant to each of the village clubs. We also help with Churchyard.
